Annotation.note:
The altitudes $AHD$, $BHE$, $CHF$ of the triangle $ABC$ are produced beyond $D$, $E$, $F$ to the points $P$, $Q$, $R$ by the lengths $AH$, $BH$, $CH$, respectively. The parallels through $P$, $Q$, $R$ to the sides $BC$, $CA$, $AB$, form a triangle $XYZ$. Show that $H$ is the centroid of the triangle $XYZ$.
\begin{keywords} geometry theorem proving \end{keywords}
